intro: Thelesperma intermedium var. flavodiscum, commonly known as the yellow disc milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in globular clusters, which are characteristic of the Fabaceae family. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a deep root system that helps it survive in drought conditions. The yellow disc milkvetch is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various therapeutic purposes.
